DataElement.preferredName: Inclusion Criteria Enrollment Repeat NGS Test Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not next generation sequencing (NGS) testing was done per enrollment inclusion criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Inclusion Criteria Enrollment Repeat Next Generation Sequencing Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Make or do or perform again._Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the DNA sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredName: Repeat Next Generation Sequencing Laboratory Procedure Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the DNA sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
Technologies that facilitate the rapid determination of the nucleotide sequence of large numbers of strands or segments of DNA or RNA.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
